languageModelTools.name: gsl_diff_with_prime
languageModelTools.userDescription: Fetch the Prime (production) version of a GSL script and return the diff against the open local script for analysis.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Downloads a GSL script from the Prime (production) server and compares it with a local open editor copy. Returns the unified diff text showing exactly what lines differ between Prime and Dev. Use this when the user wants to compare, diff, check differences, or understand what changed between their local script and the production/prime version. The tool returns the diff content directly — it does not open any UI. If scriptNumber is provided, the matching local script must already be open in the editor. Requires the GSL extension to be configured with Prime server credentials via 'GSL: Prime Server Setup'.

scriptNumber.description: Optional GSL script number to diff. If omitted, uses the currently active editor's script. When provided, the matching local script must be open in an editor.

context.description: Number of unchanged context lines to show before and after each change. Defaults to 3 (same as git diff).

languageModelTools.name: gsl_fetch_prime_script
languageModelTools.userDescription: Fetch the Prime (production) version of a GSL script and return its full content.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Downloads a GSL script from the Prime (production) server and returns the full script content as text. Use this when the user wants to read, review, or inspect the production version of a script without comparing it to the local copy. The tool returns the raw script content directly — it does not open any UI. Requires the GSL extension to be configured with Prime server credentials via 'GSL: Prime Server Setup'.

scriptNumber.description: Optional GSL script number to fetch. If omitted, uses the currently active editor's script.

languageModelTools.name: gsl_compile_check
languageModelTools.userDescription: Check a local GSL script for compiler errors by compiling it in an isolated safety script (S24661) on the development server.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Use this tool whenever the task is to check, compile, or validate GSL script compiler errors/warnings. Prefer this tool over generic error tools for GSL compile checks. It compiles a local GSL script file on the development server and returns compiler output, including line-level errors and warnings, so the model can diagnose and fix compilation problems.

filename.description: Workspace-relative or absolute path to the .gsl file to upload, such as S24661.gsl.

gslLanguageServer.maxNumberOfProblems.description: Maximum number of problems reported for document

gsl.automaticallyDownloadScripts.description: If enabled, scripts will be automatically downloaded when their matchmarker definitions are needed.

gsl.enableScriptSyncChecks.description: Enable to check sync status when downloading scripts.

gsl.disableLoginAttempts.description: Enable to permanently disable login attempts from various actions in the editor.

gsl.alwaysEnabled.description: Enable to always have the Download/Upload buttons.

gsl.displayGameChannel.description: Enable to display the Game channel when the editor starts.

gsl.downloadPath.description: Path to save downloaded scripts.  Window users: use double slashes when specifying, e.g. C:\\GemStone\\Scripts

gsl.downloadToWorkspace.description: If enabled, will attempt to save downloaded scripts in the current open root workspace folder.

gsl.fileExtension.description: File extension to use for downloaded scripts.

gsl.scriptPollingDelay.description: Set the interval for how often the extension checks if the local script is up-to-date with its remote version.  A higher delay can be useful in bandwidth-constrained situations such as on an airplane.
